TopicTitle: DEAR SQUAD - Son wants KSP apparel

Articles.Content:
My son is 5, 6 come july. He really wants a KSP tee shirt. Actually alot of his friends do, as a bunch of us dads are all players of KSP. I've been nagged, hounded and begged for one. You've never seen a kid so addicted. Between KSP and Minecraft, my son has became an honorary engineer. He builds constantly, it stimulates his creative process to a whole new level. He's even been sharper and been doing alot better in school. This all started from him WATCHING me play ksp. So for his birthday his mother and I have some gifts.

His own copy of KSP on Steam and a 3D printed Jeb, kerbin, and other various 3d prints.

But he really wants some apparel, and we'd love to get him some.

So here's the question squad. Will you hook our kids up with some KSP apparel? If its not possible, where can I send a check to have a local shop make one for me? Because I'd be more than happy to send the $30 to you guys to make his birthday a special one. He's a T-6 shirt.

Also Dad would like a bumper sticker and coffee mug that says "Mun or Bust!" in the cafe press shop. (No rush)

I'm pretty sure there's all you need on there http://www.cafepress.com/kerbalspaceprogram

EDIT: realizing you probably know of that website since you reffered to it in your post, and that you probably want one which would fit your son. Hm, they seem to be made of cotton, which would shrink in the washing machine, but I doubt that would be enough to fit him even then :/ I'll ping Rowsdower about potential smaller shirts.

Appreciate that. I thought about doing the whole "shrink" routine. But was afraid of ruining the logo image
